iati-activity.title: Support and Protection of Vulnerable Girls and Young Women living and working on the streets of Tshangu District, in Kinshasa
iati-activity.description: * Child Protection – VGYW access to medical care (night ambulance, 24h drop-in centre for girls, referral & accompaniment, psychosocial support and counselling) * VGWY’s skills & basic social / human capital (life-skills courses, literacy and numeracy courses, reproductive and sexual health and family planning, re-enrolment into formal school or vocational training courses) *socioeconomic reintegration opportunities (family tracing& reintegration, financial literacy courses, development of business plans & start-up kits, M&E business activities)

* Child Protection – VGYW access to medical care (night ambulance, 24h drop-in centre for girls, referral & accompaniment, psychosocial support and counselling) * VGWY’s skills & basic social / human capital (life-skills courses, literacy and numeracy courses, reproductive and sexual health and family planning, re-enrolment into formal school or vocational training courses) *socioeconomic reintegration opportunities (family tracing& reintegration, financial literacy courses, development of business plans & start-up kits, M&E business activities)

The project will result in increased support and protection for the vulnerable girls and young women (VGYW) working and living on the streets of Tshangu District by generating evidence base for scaled up intervention aimed at socio-economic empowerment of adolescent girls.

The project will target 1,740 vulnerable girls and young women living and working on the streets of Tshangu District. This will include 1,680 girls and women accessing services and support through the night ambulance and 60 girls (between 5 and 20 years old) using the transit centre. In addition, 728 men and boys will also benefit from the services of the night ambulance, and 12 families will receive livelihoods support to enable the sustainable reintegration of girls.
